verses.verse: Passover Regulations And the LORD said to Moses and Aaron, “This is (Ex. 12:11; Num. 9:14) the ordinance of the Passover: No foreigner shall eat it.
But every man’s servant who is bought for money, when you have (Gen. 17:12, 13; Lev. 22:11) circumcised him, then he may eat it.
(Lev. 22:10) A sojourner and a hired servant shall not eat it.
In one house it shall be eaten; you shall not carry any of the flesh outside the house, (Num. 9:12; Ps. 34:20; (John 19:33, 36)) nor shall you break one of its bones.
(Ex. 12:6; Num. 9:13, 14) All the congregation of Israel shall keep it.

And (Num. 9:14) when a stranger dwells with you and wants to keep the Passover to the LORD, let all his males be circumcised, and then let him come near and keep it; and he shall be as a native of the land. For no uncircumcised person shall eat it.
(Lev. 24:22; Num. 15:15, 16; (Gal. 3:28)) One law shall be for the native-born and for the stranger who dwells among you.”
Thus all the children of Israel did; as the LORD commanded Moses and Aaron, so they did.
(Ex. 12:41; 20:2) And it came to pass, on that very same day, that the LORD brought the children of Israel out of the land of Egypt (Ex. 6:26) according to their armies.
The Firstborn Consecrated Then the LORD spoke to Moses, saying,

(Ex. 13:12, 13, 15; 22:29; Lev. 27:26; Num. 3:13; 8:16; 18:15; Deut. 15:19; Luke 2:23) “Consecrate to Me all the firstborn, whatever opens the womb among the children of Israel, both of man and beast; it is Mine.”

The Feast of Unleavened Bread And Moses said to the people: (Ex. 12:42; Deut. 16:3) “Remember this day in which you went out of Egypt, out of the house of bondage; for (Ex. 3:20; 6:1) by strength of hand the LORD brought you out of this place. (Ex. 12:8, 19) No leavened bread shall be eaten.
(Ex. 12:2; 23:15; 34:18; Deut. 16:1) On this day you are going out, in the month Abib.

And it shall be, when the LORD (Ex. 3:8, 17; Josh. 24:11) brings you into the (Gen. 17:8; Deut. 30:5) land of the Canaanites and the Hittites and the Amorites and the Hivites and the Jebusites, which He (Ex. 6:8) swore to your fathers to give you, a land flowing with milk and honey, (Ex. 12:25, 26) that you shall keep this service in this month.
(Ex. 12:15-20) Seven days you shall eat unleavened bread, and on the seventh day there shall be a feast to the LORD.
Unleavened bread shall be eaten seven days. And (Ex. 12:19) no leavened bread shall be seen among you, nor shall leaven be seen among you in all your quarters.
And you shall (Ex. 10:2; 12:26; 13:14; Ps. 44:1) tell your son in that day, saying, ‘This is done because of what the LORD did for me when I came up from Egypt.’

It shall be as (Ex. 12:14; 13:16; 31:13; Deut. 6:8; 11:18; Matt. 23:5) a sign to you on your hand and as a memorial between your eyes, that the LORD’s law may be in your mouth; for with a strong hand the LORD has brought you out of Egypt.
(Ex. 12:14, 24) You shall therefore keep this ordinance in its season from year to year.
The Law of the Firstborn “And it shall be, when the LORD (Ex. 13:5) brings you into the land of the (Num. 21:3) Canaanites, as He swore to you and your fathers, and gives it to you,

(Ex. 13:1, 2; 22:29; 34:19; Lev. 27:26; Num. 18:15; Ezek. 44:30; Luke 2:23) that you shall set apart to the LORD all that open the womb, that is, every firstborn that comes from an animal which you have; the males shall be the LORD’s.

But (Ex. 34:20; Num. 18:15) every firstborn of a donkey you shall redeem with a lamb; and if you will not redeem it, then you shall break its neck. And all the firstborn of man among your sons (Num. 3:46, 47; 18:15, 16) you shall redeem.
